title: We all know how fast an apocalypse can happen, but how slowly can an apocalypse happen? - Quora

response.answer_text: I will assume that you are using the meaning of “great disaster”. Disaster - Wikipedia I would doubt that there is an upper limit. The Milky Way and Andromeda are on a collision course, but that will happen after the Sun has become a red giant. NASA - NASA's Hubble Shows Milky Way is Destined for Head-On Collision There are beaches and cliffs around the world that are disappearing or collapsing, which could be a slow motion apocalypse Landslide leaves caravans teetering on the edge of a cliff. Cultural or political changes? Ground water overuse? Maybe something like the Titanic, it didn’t sink very quickly.

We may be in a slow apocalypses right now, Bees are being killed by an unknown cause, (though pesticides are the first suspected culprit.) No Bees, no pollination. Food will get harder and harder to come by. Please pray for our Bees and do what you can to help them: Plant wildflowers, don’t use pesticides and encourage others to do the same.
